73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (17:39): in o10.5x i get:
936e36f7a71852e10a649295a6a9729f (17:39): definitive list, I'll update my trim()'s!
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (17:43): note that this is whitespace in ecmascript eval()
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (17:44): whitespace in ecmascript source is hopefully the same
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (17:44): but whitespace in other places is different
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:44): "other places"?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (17:44): i mean like in html and css
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:45): Well yes, ECMAScript says "all other characters in unicode class Zs" or something
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:45): HTML has a shor fixed list
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:46): (ECMAScript also has a short list or doesn't-matter-what-unicode-says characters)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (17:46): the ecmascript definition is annoying because it doesn't say which version of unicode, just requires unicode 2.0 or later (or something)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (17:46): and it changes over time
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:47): pretty great that we are now at the point where we can argue over whitespace definitions rather than all the shit we had to emulate from IE6 :p
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:48): (it says "must... Unicode 3.0 ... may ... later versions")
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:48): (of course, it's not quite like that, but it certainly has improved)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:48): (so even if characters are moved out of Zs in later versions, tehy still have to be recognised as whitespace)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:48): (which has happened a couple of times iirc)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:49): wait what?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:49): oh god
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:55): you pointing out it's as inconsistent as hell
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:56): Well not really
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:57): It's slightly more consistent than just saying "whatever versuion of unicode you like"
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:57): slightly less consistent than saying "just this set of characters"
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (17:58): Unicode versions are a pain no matter how you handle them...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:10): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, latest version would have been more consistent
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:12): relying on specifications not evolving is silly and codifying it is worse
